alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 16 at 8:12PM MDT until June 17 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 12 PM TO 9 PM SATURDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, EAST CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will continue across the area Saturday. Between 6 and 12 hours of single digit relative humidity readings are expected in the Middle Rio Grande Valley with a few hours possible elsewhere. Gusty westerly to southwesterly winds are expected Saturday afternoon and evening resulting in several hours of critical fire weather conditions. Any fires that develop will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT SATURDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the East Central Plains (Zone 126) Saturday afternoon and evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West and southwest at 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 9 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
